archivedTasks.title: TESTING: Real-world production testing of v0.14.0 (NOT BATS)
archivedTasks.description:
## Purpose
Validate v0.14.0 in real-world production scenarios, not just BATS unit tests.
BATS tests pass (1124/1124) but we need to verify:
1. Fresh project initialization works
2. Existing project migration/repair works
3. All commands function correctly in real usage
4. Edge cases that BATS may not cover

## Test Scenarios

### Scenario 1: Fresh Project Setup
```bash
mkdir /tmp/test-fresh && cd /tmp/test-fresh
claude-todo init
claude-todo add "Test task 1" --priority high --phase setup
claude-todo add "Test task 2" --depends T001
claude-todo focus set T001
claude-todo session start
# ... use for real work ...
claude-todo complete T001 --notes "Done"
claude-todo phase advance
claude-todo session end
```

### Scenario 2: Existing Project Migration
Test with a project that has:
- Old v2.1.0 format (string project field)
- Missing phases
- Wrong phase structure
```bash
claude-todo migrate status
claude-todo migrate run --auto
claude-todo migrate repair --dry-run
claude-todo migrate repair --auto
claude-todo validate
```

### Scenario 3: Complex Workflow
- Multiple tasks with dependencies
- Blocked tasks
- Archive operations
- Export to various formats
- Phase transitions

### Scenario 4: Edge Cases
- Very large task counts (100+ tasks)
- Special characters in titles/descriptions
- Concurrent operations
- Network disconnection during operations

### Scenario 5: Error Recovery
- Intentionally corrupt todo.json
- Run validate --fix
- Verify recovery works

## Success Criteria
- All scenarios complete without errors
- Data integrity maintained throughout
- No data loss in any scenario
- Commands produce expected output
- Help text is accurate and complete

## Deliverables
- Test report with pass/fail for each scenario
- List of any bugs discovered
- Recommendations for documentation updates
notes:
2025-12-16 23:53:23 UTC: PRODUCTION TESTING RESULTS v0.14.0

=== SCENARIO 1: Fresh Project Setup ===
✅ PASS
- init: Creates 5-phase structure correctly
- add: Works with phases, dependencies, labels
- focus: Auto-switches project phase
- session start/end: Works correctly
- complete: With notes, clears focus
- phases/phase: Display and advance work

=== SCENARIO 2: Migration ===
✅ PASS
- migrate status: Detects old v2.1.0 schema
- migrate run --auto: Upgrades to v2.2.0, creates 5-phase structure
- migrate repair --dry-run: Shows all needed fixes
- migrate repair --auto: Fixes phase structure, preserves data
- Idempotent: Second repair shows 'no repairs needed'

=== SCENARIO 3: Complex Workflow ===
✅ PASS
- Multiple tasks with dependencies
- Blocked tasks (manual and dependency-based)
- deps command: Shows dependency graph
- blockers: Shows blocked tasks with reasons
- archive: Respects retention rules
- export --format json/todowrite
- next --explain: Scoring breakdown

=== SCENARIO 4: Edge Cases ===
✅ PASS
- Special characters in titles: ✅
- Emoji in titles: ✅
- Newlines correctly rejected: ✅
- 108 tasks: Performance acceptable
- exists command: Correct exit codes
- validate at scale: 1.5s for 108 tasks

=== SCENARIO 5: Error Recovery ===
✅ PASS
- Checksum corruption detected
- validate --fix recovers checksum
- backup/restore cycle works
- Full data recovery from corrupted file

=== BUGS FOUND ===
1. COSMETIC: 'readonly variable' warnings when validation.sh sourced multiple times
2. BUG: migrate repair doesn't update checksum after modifications (requires validate --fix)
3. BUG: TodoWrite export activeForm conjugation broken ('Coring', 'Testinging')

archivedTasks.title: Implement 'migrate repair' command for full schema compliance
archivedTasks.description:
Create a comprehensive repair command that ensures all .claude/ files match their canonical schema structures. Must be idempotent (safe to run multiple times without data loss).

SCOPE:
1. Phase structure repair (canonical 5-phase: setup→core→testing→polish→maintenance)
2. _meta field validation and repair (checksum, configVersion, schemaVersion, version)
3. focus object structure validation
4. project object structure (name, currentPhase, phases)
5. Task field validation (required fields with defaults)
6. Remove obsolete/invalid fields

BEHAVIOR:
- claude-todo migrate repair (interactive)
- claude-todo migrate repair --auto (auto-apply)
- claude-todo migrate repair --dry-run (preview only)

DATA INTEGRITY REQUIREMENTS:
- MUST preserve all existing task data
- MUST preserve existing phase statuses/timestamps where valid
- MUST create backup before any modifications
- MUST be idempotent (running twice = same result)
- MUST log all changes to todo-log.json

IMPLEMENTATION:
- Add repair subcommand to scripts/migrate.sh
- Add repair functions to lib/migrate.sh
- Add schema comparison logic
- Add field-by-field repair with defaults
notes: [COMPLETED 2025-12-16T21:34:38Z] Implemented migrate repair command with schema comparison, repair execution, backup/restore, idempotent operation

archivedTasks.title: T227.6: Hook Integration Architecture

archivedTasks.title: Documentation Completeness Audit: Full CLI Command Coverage
archivedTasks.description:
## Overview
Comprehensive audit and completion of CLI command documentation. Ensure all 25 commands are properly documented with consistent structure across all documentation touchpoints.

## Documentation Architecture
```
docs/commands/*.md     → Detailed command reference (source of truth for each command)
docs/INDEX.md          → Master index pointing to all documentation
docs/TODO_Task_Management.md → LLM-facing instructions (concise, references docs/commands/)
templates/CLAUDE-INJECTION.md → Quick reference (essential commands only, points to TODO_Task_Management.md)
```

## Current State (v0.12.8)

### CLI Commands vs Documentation Coverage

| # | Command | docs/commands/ | INDEX.md | TODO_Task_Mgmt | CLAUDE-INJECTION |
|---|---------|----------------|----------|----------------|------------------|
| 1 | init | ❌ | ❌ | ✅ | ❌ |

archivedTasks.title: Implement 'show' command for single-task detail view
archivedTasks.description:
## Problem
LLM agents are trying to use `claude-todo show T036` which doesn't exist. This command was proposed in performance research (Dec 12) as part of lazy loading strategy but never implemented.

## Error Observed
```
Unknown command: show
Did you mean one of these?
```

## Source of Confusion
Performance research document recommended:
- `list` → minimal task info (fast, 20ms for 1000 tasks)
- `show <id>` → full task details (5ms for single task)

This pattern is documented in:
1. Claude session logs from Dec 12 research
2. Possibly in LLM instruction files referencing 'show' command

## Current Workaround
```bash
claude-todo list --format json | jq '.tasks[] | select(.id == "T036")'
```

## Proposed Implementation
1. Create scripts/show.sh
2. Add to CMD_MAP: [show]="show.sh"
3. Add to CMD_DESC: [show]="Show detailed view of a single task"
4. Add to help loop
5. Features:
   - Display all task fields in formatted view
   - Show dependency chain (what blocks this, what this blocks)
   - Show related tasks by label
   - Show task history from log
   - Optional: --json for raw output

## Acceptance Criteria
- `claude-todo show T001` displays full task details
- Includes notes, files, acceptance criteria if present
- Shows dependency relationships
- Performance: <50ms for single task lookup
notes: [COMPLETED 2025-12-15T19:51:39Z] Implemented show command: scripts/show.sh (420 lines), docs/commands/show.md, updated TODO_Task_Management.md with Task Inspection section, updated CLAUDE-INJECTION.md template. Features: full task details, dependency info, --history, --related, --include-archive, JSON output.

archivedTasks.title: Implement circular dependency detection
archivedTasks.description: Detect circular dependencies using Tarjan's SCC algorithm. Warn on cycle detection. Block task creation that would create cycles. Report cycle chain in deps check.

archivedTasks.title: Implement deps command with dependency tree visualization
archivedTasks.description: ASCII dependency tree (├─►). Subcommands: show TASK_ID, check (validate/detect cycles), blocked (tasks with incomplete deps). Options: --depth N, --reverse. Topological sorting.

archivedTasks.title: Implement blockers command for blocker analysis
archivedTasks.description: List blocked tasks and what blocks them. Subcommand: analyze - show critical path, chain length, impact assessment, recommendations. Help identify bottlenecks.

archivedTasks.title: Add output.* configuration options
archivedTasks.description: Add to config.schema.json: output.defaultFormat, output.colorEnabled, output.unicodeEnabled, output.progressBars, output.csvDelimiter, output.dateFormat. Integrate into output-format.sh.

archivedTasks.title: Add ASCII progress bar and box-drawing support
archivedTasks.description: Progress bars with Unicode blocks (██░) and percentages. Box-drawing borders for tables (╭╮╰╯─│). ASCII fallback for non-UTF8 terminals.

archivedTasks.title: Implement labels command for tag management
archivedTasks.description: List all labels with counts and bar visualization. Subcommands: show LABEL. Show critical task counts per label. Alias: tags.

archivedTasks.title: Implement next command for task suggestion
archivedTasks.description: Suggest next task to work on. Algorithm: filter pending+unblocked, sort by priority/deps/created. Options: --explain, --count N. Show reasoning for suggestion.

archivedTasks.title: Implement dash (dashboard) command
archivedTasks.description: New command showing: status overview, current focus, phase progress with bars, weekly stats. Options: --compact, --period N, --no-chart. Uses box-drawing for borders.

archivedTasks.title: Add CSV and TSV export formats
archivedTasks.description: Add --format csv and --format tsv to export.sh. RFC 4180 compliant CSV. Include headers option, configurable delimiter. Essential for spreadsheet integration.

archivedTasks.title: Add JSON output envelope with _meta section
archivedTasks.description: Enhance JSON output with envelope pattern: _meta (version, command, timestamp, checksum, execution_ms), filters applied, summary counts, then tasks array. Improves LLM anti-hallucination.

archivedTasks.title: Create lib/output-format.sh shared library
archivedTasks.description: Create shared library with: detect_color_support(), detect_unicode_support(), get_terminal_width(), resolve_format(), status_color(), status_symbol(), progress_bar(), draw_box(). Used by all output commands.

archivedTasks.title: Implement NO_COLOR environment variable support
archivedTasks.description: Respect the NO_COLOR environment variable standard (no-color.org) to disable all ANSI color codes. Also add FORCE_COLOR for override.
